abstract: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen’s vision of creating a wired world — where computers, televisions and other devices are linked up together — through his investment firm, isn’t panning out too well at the moment, CNet News says.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen’s vision of creating a wired world — where computers, televisions and other devices are linked up together — through his investment firm, isn’t panning out too well at the moment, CNet News says.

headline.main: Paul Allen’s Vision Hits Some Hurdles
